intro: Myrobalanus riedelii, commonly known as the Riedel's sea mango, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces edible fruits that are typically consumed fresh or used in traditional medicine. Its adaptability to saline and coastal environments makes it an important species in coastal ecosystems. Myrobalanus riedelii plays a vital role in stabilizing dune systems and supporting local biodiversity.
